    Deploy and manage a stateful application by using Azure Cosmos DB and Azure Kubernetes Service - Understand state management in Kubernetes

    »

    1. What is the persistent state of an application?

      It’s the type of state that continues to exist even after the application has been closed.

      It’s the state that’s stored in memory or locally on the container.

      It’s all the disks and volumes that compose the application.


    2. How does Kubernetes handle states?

      It doesn’t. Kubernetes don’t have state-handling features.

      It externalizes the state to another node outside the cluster.

      It uses a set of objects called PersistentVolume and PersistentVolumeClaim.


    3. What’s a best practice for handling state in Kubernetes applications?

      Store the state inside Kubernetes only.

      Remove any possible state and use only ephemeral storage.

      Delegate the state management to external specialized solutions.
